result.execSummary:
The defendant John A Martin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-Heroin(>10-50g), a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(d)3.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Pay DNA surcharge, all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges.  Bail to apply.

Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.
Defendant is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse program; and is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.  If found eligible, and after serving four (4) years of Initial Confinement.

superMiscConds.notes:
No alcohol.  No controlled substances without a valid prescription.
No association with known drug user or dealers.  No contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged or distributed.
Pay all supervision fees.  To  make regular payments.
AODA assessment.  Comply with recommended treatment.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Random drug tests.

supervisions.notes:
Provide DNA sample.
Court advised defendant will have to provide a DNA sample to Wisconsin State Crime Laboratory for DNA testing.  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms; and that his voting rights are suspended and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

Defendant's pro se motion to modify sentence.
Original Transcript (65 pages) ORAL RULING/PLEA AND SENTENCING HEARING(ADJOURNED) commencing JANUARY 07, 2015 10:14 AM - 4:07 PM received and filed.
Original Transcript (32 pages) SENTENCING HEARING commencing JANUARY 08, 2015 4:21 PM - 4:55 PM received and filed.
15A 000695/reversed

Defendant John A Martin in court with attorney Crystal L. Saltzwadel.  Defendant John A Martin in custody.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Sentencing hearing continued.  Statements by defense and defendant.  

The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 10 YEARS, CONSECUTIVE with any other sentence, with credit for 147 DAYS time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 5 YEARS, the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 5 YEARS.  The defendant IS ELIGIBLE for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program and IS ELIGIBLE for the Challenge Incarceration Program, IF FOUND ELIGIBLE, AND AFTER SERVING FOUR (4) YEARS OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT. 

The Court imposed the following conditions of extended supervision:  

- AODA assessment and comply with any recommended treatment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety, no alcohol, no controlled substances without a valid prescription, with random drug tests.
- Seek and maintain full time employment.
- No association with known drug users or dealers, and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
- Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA sample, and to pay all MANDATORY COURT costs, fees, assessments, and surcharges.  Cash bail to apply.              Balance to be returned to poster.
- Pay all supervision fees.  Defendant to make regular payments.

Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.

Received and filed:
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit;
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.  aw

Defendant John A Martin in court with attorney Crystal L. Saltzwadel.  Defendant John A Martin in custody.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 

Case resumed.  Defendant wishes to enter a plea.

Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea
Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction entered.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Court also advises defendant if he is not a citizen of the United States of America, that upon a plea of guilty or no contest for this offense, he could be deported, excluded from admission to his country, or denied naturalization under federal law.  
Court advised that the defendant will have to provide a DNA sample, to the Wisconsin State Crime Laboratory for DNA testing.
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement, received and filed.  aw

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State.  Case adjourned due to the lateness of the hour.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing on 1/8/2015 at 2:30 pm, in Branch 3.  aw  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 8, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant John A Martin in court with attorney Crystal L. Saltzwadel.  Defendant John A Martin in custody.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court DENIES defendant's motion to suppress for reasons stated on the record.  Case passed to see how defendant wants to proceed.  aw

Defendant John A Martin in court with attorney Crystal L. Saltzwadel.  Defendant John A Martin in custody.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case scheduled for oral ruling and scheduling.  Attorney Saltzwadel has just received discovery today.  Case adjourned for oral ruling and final pretrial on 1/7/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.   aw  Final pre-trial scheduled for January 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Oral ruling scheduled for January 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Crystal L. Saltzwadel in court, defendant John A Martin not in court, in custody.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin for Antonella Aleman.
Defense counsel has just been appointed, and needs discovery.  Case adjourned for oral ruling and scheduling conference on 12/8/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  Court ordered all motions be filed by the next court date.  aw  Scheduling conference scheduled for December 8, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Oral ruling scheduled for December 8, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant John A Martin in court with attorney Matthew Russell Meyer.  Defendant John A Martin in custody.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Motion of the defense counsel to withdraw granted by the Court.  Clerk will contact Public Defender's office to have new counsel appointed.
Case adjourned for status of counsel and oral ruling in Branch 3. 
Oral ruling scheduled for November 24, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Status conference scheduled for November 24, 2014 at 08:30 am.
State's response in opposition to the defendant's motion to suppress, received and filed.  aw

Attorney Matthew Russell Meyer in court, defendant John A Martin not in court, in custody.  Dennis P. Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel has filed a motion.  State to respond by 10/23/2014.  Defense reply do by 10/30/2014.  Case adjourned for oral ruling on 11/10/2014 at 8:30 am, final pretrial on 12/8/2014, and for jury trial on 2/18/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.   Filed, signed Felony Pretrial Scheduling Order.  aw
Notice of motion and motion to suppress evidence (Illegal search- Insufficient Search Warrant), received and filed.  aw

Attorney Matthew Russell Meyer in court, defendant John A Martin not in court, in custody.  Dennis P. Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin for Antonella Aleman.
Court is in trial.  Defense counsel requests time to file a motion.  Case adjourned for scheduling conference on 10/2/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  All motions due next court date.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  aw  Scheduling conference scheduled for October 2, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant John A Martin in court with attorney Matthew Russell Meyer, Attorney Bridget Krause on behalf of Danielle Shelton.  Defendant John A Martin in custody.  Nathaniel Adamson for Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Motion of the defense counsel Shelton to withdraw, is granted by the Court.
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 16, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for ENHANCED Supervision.  Defendant to be drug tested.  Court orders defendant to not use or possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Attorney Danielle L. Shelton in court, defendant John A Martin not in court, in custody.  Dennis P. Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin for Antonella Aleman.
Defendant was picked up on a warrant.  Court cancels warrant.  Case adjourned for preliminary hearing on 9/3/2014 at 8:30 am, branch PE.  aw  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 3, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant was picked up on a warrant.  Clerk spoke with attorney Shelton.  Case adjourned for return on warrant on 8/25/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  aw
No reply from defendant.

Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 500.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Attorney Danielle L Shelton in court earlier this morning.  Nathaniel Adamson for Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
ADA Aleman called to inform the Court that the defendant has fled to Texas, per Probation Agent.  Defendant having failed to appear, the court ordered a bench warrant to issue, any bond forfeited and Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification by the Clerk of Circuit Court.
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances (NO ILLEGAL DRUGS).   The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.

Defendant John A Martin in court with attorney Danielle L Shelton.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.     Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 1, 2014 at 08:30 am.
